brief_summary.textblock:
To study ownership and use of cell phones in low-income smokers. This may help us better
      understand the impact of cell phone ownership plans on low income smokers' access to
      quitlines.  Use of quitlines may be impeded by limited access to landline phones and limited
      airtime minutes on cell phones.

clinical_study.brief_title: Survey of Smokers Treated in the Emergency Department (ED) on Ownership and Usage of Cell Phones

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age 18 or over

          -  speak and understand English

          -  willing and able to give informed consent

          -  have smoked more than 100 cigarettes lifetime

          -  are currently a daily or some day smoker

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  too ill or unable to consent

          -  not interested in participation

          -  actively psychotic or mentally ill and unable to give consent

          -  in police custody

          -  resides in an extended care facility.

study_pop.textblock:
Subjects will be current patients in the Yale New Haven Hospital Emergency Department who
        were previously identified as smokers.

intervention.description: Eight item survey for smokers being treated in the YNHH Emergency Dept.  The survey asks about the type of cell phone(s) subjects have, how much they pay for cell service monthly, housing status, and if they receive any benefit that would qualify them for the Lifeline program.

clinical_study.official_title: Survey of Smokers Treated in the ED on Ownership and Usage of Cell Phones

primary_outcome.description: The proportion of participants who have lifeline wireless phones (AKA "Medicaid phones").
primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with lifeline wireless phones

primary_outcome.description: The proportion of participants with limited wireless minutes each month, stratified by insurance.
primary_outcome.measure: proportion of participants with limited wireless minutes

primary_outcome.description: The proportion of participants with unlimited wireless minutes each month, stratified by insurance status.
primary_outcome.measure: proportion of participants with unlimited wireless minutes

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
